intro: Chionodoxa salbacus, commonly known as the Persian glory-of-the-snow, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran and Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers, which are borne on slender stems above its grass-like foliage. Its bulbs are perennial, allowing it to return year after year in suitable climates. Chionodoxa salbacus is well-suited for rock gardens and woodland settings, where it thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade.
